alert.note: Alert for Kent (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 6:38PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kent County through 715 PM CDT... At 637 PM CDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 8 miles northwest of Clairemont, or 16 miles south of Spur, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARDS...Penny size hail and brief funnel clouds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jayton and Clairemont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds with this storm. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
